definition: to take root
to prick/to run or stick (a needle etc) into/jug (a classifier for liquids such as beer)
to tie/to bind/classifier for flowers, banknotes etc: bundle/Taiwan pr. [zha2]
variant of 紮|扎[za1]
penetrating (as of cold)/struggle
variant of 紮|扎[zha1]
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)

sentences.chinese: 这种源自美国的理论能在中国本土扎根吗？

sentences.english: The young tree has struck root.
Feel your feet root into the ground beneath you.
sentences.chinese: 感觉你的脚深深的扎根进地面里。

sentences.english: "Vitality Home" was always in disaster area after 512.
sentences.chinese: “生命力家园”在512地震之后一直扎根在灾区。

sentences.english: The trees have rooted in the rich soil.
sentences.chinese: 树木在肥沃的土壤里已经扎根。

sentences.english: Creation is then rooted in the mutual love of the persons of the Triune God.
sentences.chinese: 接着，受造之物被扎根在三一神位格互相内住的爱里。

sentences.english: Closing your eyes and breathing into your belly, imagine roots growing from your feet deep into the ground.
sentences.chinese: 闭上双眼，气沉丹田，想象双足深深扎根于大地。

sentences.english: The plants push their roots deep into the soil.
sentences.chinese: 植物深深地扎根于土中。

sentences.english: We need to be grounded in research.
I have a dream, this dream deeply is radicate in the aureole of the human nature under.
sentences.chinese: 我有一个梦想，这梦想深深扎根于人性的光环之下。

sentences.english: Rabbits rip up their shoots before they can take proper root.
sentences.chinese: 兔子在花葵扎根前撕裂它们的幼芽。

sentences.english: Deep care, like a long cane rooted in people's soul.
sentences.chinese: 深深的牵挂，像一根长藤扎根在人们的魂灵。

sentences.english: Art as mimesis or representation has deep roots in the philosophy of Aristotle.
sentences.chinese: 艺术模仿或代表已深深扎根于亚里士多德的哲学。

sentences.english: Some of them have been based here as long as eight years.
sentences.chinese: 他们中的一些已经扎根此地八年有余了。

sentences.english: It understand that, only the earth, they took root to a green.
sentences.chinese: 它深知，只有扎根大地，才能绽出一片新绿。

sentences.english: Rooted in one dear perpetual place.
sentences.chinese: 在一个珍爱的地方扎根永驻。

definition: to take root/to establish a base
air plant (Bryophyllum pinnatum)/to put down roots
fertile land
to be rooted to/to take root in
to stand/to have a footing/to be established/to base oneself on
deep plowing/thorough penetration/thorough development (of a market segment etc)
stable household, established profession (idiom); settled and comfortably off
foundation
deep-rooted (problem etc)
deep plowing and careful cultivation
homeland/hot piece of real estate
to tower/to stand straight (of person's bearing)
hibernation/living in seclusion
to settle (in some city, country etc)/to take up residence
to be pregnant/to produce offspring/to nurture (a development, school of thought, artwork etc)/fig. replete with (culture etc)
deposits accumulated over long periods/fig. valuable experience, accumulated wisdom
